CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new alternating copolymer ( PSFDTBT ) based on spirobifluorene , thiophene , and benzothiadiazole units has been synthesized. PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV with the low - lying HOMO energy level at -5.4 eV. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . Polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V and a power conversion efficiency of 4.6% without any post-treatment. All the device measurements were performed in air without encapsulation. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based conjugated polymers used for polymer solar cells , demonstrating the great potential of spirobifluorene moiety as an electron - donating unit for the construction of main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers for high performance polymer solar cells . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , as the most promising sustainable energy source alternative to inorganic - based solar cells , have received intensive attention in both academia and industry in recent years. 1 In comparison with inorganic solar cells , PSCs have the potential advantages of lightweight , flexibility , and manufacturing by low cost roll - to - roll process. 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells. 1,3 Intensive researches worldwide on polymer design and device fabrication have led to a rapid development in the field of PSCs. 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors. 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing. 7 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating design is a very efficient way to engineer the band gap of conjugated polymers through the internal charge transfer from donor to acceptor unit.

Let's think step by step.

1. Spirobifluorene
2. Thiophene
3. Benzothiadiazole
4. PSFDTBT (a copolymer consisting of spirobifluorene, thiophene, and benzothiadiazole units)
5. o-dichlorobenzene (DCB)
6. PC71BM (used as an electron acceptor in polymer solar cells)
7. Conjugated polymers (mentioned as electron donating units in the main chain donor-acceptor alternating conjugated polymers)
8. [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM)
9. [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)
10. Highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO)
11. Lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO)

These are the material names mentioned in the given paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. Spirobifluorene
2. Thiophene
3. Benzothiadiazole
4. PSFDTBT
5. o-dichlorobenzene (DCB)
6. PC71BM
7. Conjugated polymers
8. [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM)
9. [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)

These are the material names that clearly refer to specific materials in the given paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Spirobifluorene |
| Thiophene |
| Benzothiadiazole |
| PSFDTBT |
| o-dichlorobenzene (DCB) |
| PC71BM |
| Conjugated polymers |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM) |
| [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new alternating copolymer ( PSFDTBT ) based on spirobifluorene , thiophene , and benzothiadiazole units has been synthesized. PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV with the low - lying HOMO energy level at -5.4 eV. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . Polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V and a power conversion efficiency of 4.6% without any post-treatment. All the device measurements were performed in air without encapsulation. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based conjugated polymers used for polymer solar cells , demonstrating the great potential of spirobifluorene moiety as an electron - donating unit for the construction of main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers for high performance polymer solar cells . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , as the most promising sustainable energy source alternative to inorganic - based solar cells , have received intensive attention in both academia and industry in recent years. 1 In comparison with inorganic solar cells , PSCs have the potential advantages of lightweight , flexibility , and manufacturing by low cost roll - to - roll process. 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells. 1,3 Intensive researches worldwide on polymer design and device fabrication have led to a rapid development in the field of PSCs. 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors. 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing. 7 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating design is a very efficient way to engineer the band gap of conjugated polymers through the internal charge transfer from donor to acceptor unit.

Let's think step by step.

1. PSFDTBT: A new alternating copolymer based on spirobifluorene, thiophene, and benzothiadiazole units.
2. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) energy level: The low-lying HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT is at -5.4 eV.
3. Optical band gap: PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV.
4. Hole mobility: The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1.
5. On/off ratios: The on/off ratios of the PSFDTBT-based polymer solar cell devices are in the order of 10^5.
6. Open-circuit voltage: Polymer solar cell devices based on PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open-circuit voltage of 0.94 V.
7. Power conversion efficiency (PCE): The power conversion efficiency of the PSFDTBT-based polymer solar cell devices is 4.6%.
8. Electron donating unit: The spirobifluorene moiety in PSFDTBT serves as an electron-donating unit.
9. Electron accepting fullerene derivatives: PC71BM is used as an electron accepting fullerene derivative in the blend films.
10. Highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO): The polymer should have appropriate HOMO and LUMO energy levels for harvesting photons from solar radiation.
11. Carrier mobility: The polymer/PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating and collecting free charge carriers.
12. Solubility: The polymer should be soluble in common organic solvents for solution processing.

These are the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. PSFDTBT: A new alternating copolymer based on spirobifluorene, thiophene, and benzothiadiazole units.
2. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) energy level: The low-lying HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT is at -5.4 eV.
3. Optical band gap: PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV.
4. Hole mobility: The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1.
5. Open-circuit voltage: Polymer solar cell devices based on PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open-circuit voltage of 0.94 V.
6. Power conversion efficiency (PCE): The power conversion efficiency of the PSFDTBT-based polymer solar cell devices is 4.6%.
7. Electron donating unit: The spirobifluorene moiety in PSFDTBT serves as an electron-donating unit.
8. Electron accepting fullerene derivatives: PC71BM is used as an electron accepting fullerene derivative in the blend films.
9. HOMO and LUMO: The polymer should have appropriate HOMO and LUMO energy levels for harvesting photons from solar radiation.

These are the property names of materials that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new alternating copolymer ( PSFDTBT ) based on spirobifluorene , thiophene , and benzothiadiazole units has been synthesized. PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV with the low - lying HOMO energy level at -5.4 eV. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . Polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V and a power conversion efficiency of 4.6% without any post-treatment. All the device measurements were performed in air without encapsulation. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based conjugated polymers used for polymer solar cells , demonstrating the great potential of spirobifluorene moiety as an electron - donating unit for the construction of main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers for high performance polymer solar cells . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , as the most promising sustainable energy source alternative to inorganic - based solar cells , have received intensive attention in both academia and industry in recent years. 1 In comparison with inorganic solar cells , PSCs have the potential advantages of lightweight , flexibility , and manufacturing by low cost roll - to - roll process. 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells. 1,3 Intensive researches worldwide on polymer design and device fabrication have led to a rapid development in the field of PSCs. 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors. 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing. 7 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating design is a very efficient way to engineer the band gap of conjugated polymers through the internal charge transfer from donor to acceptor unit.

Let's think step by step.

1. Optical band gap of PSFDTBT: 1.97 eV
2. HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT: -5.4 eV
3. Hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film: 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
4. Open-circuit voltage of polymer solar cell devices based on PSFDTBT and PC71BM: 0.94 V
5. Power conversion efficiency of polymer solar cell devices based on PSFDTBT and PC71BM: 4.6%
6. Power conversion efficiency of bulk heterojunction polymer solar cells: higher than 7% (achieved by several groups)

Note: The units for the values are eV for energy gap and energy levels, cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 for hole mobility, V for open-circuit voltage, and % for power conversion efficiency.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. 1.97 eV (optical band gap of PSFDTBT)
2. -5.4 eV (HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT)
3. 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film)
4. 0.94 V (open-circuit voltage of polymer solar cell devices based on PSFDTBT and PC71BM)
5. 4.6% (power conversion efficiency of polymer solar cell devices based on PSFDTBT and PC71BM)
6. higher than 7% (power conversion efficiency of bulk heterojunction polymer solar cells)
